intro: Phytocrene racemosa, commonly known as the clustered phytocrene, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Phytocrene racemosa is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential medicinal properties.
